This option lets you define if the navigational text, like 'Previous Page' or 'Next Page', should be hidden if these text is not a link. This is useful to hide 'Next Page' on last page and 'Prev Page' on first page etc.,.

If this page will be nested (in another page, or in a design), its form will be visible at a URL different to this page's URL. Use this setting to control whether the search form should submit to the same URL it's displayed at, or to this page's own URL.
The thesaurus asset selected here will be used for synonym searching. If none is selected then synonym searching will not be available

If enabled, a second search will take place using the synonyms of the search term entered in this field if the original search term returns zero results. Use the drop-down to select the field to search with. All other search fields will use the term(s) used in the original search.

This option will iterate through the supplied search string and search the Thesaurus for groups of two-or-more words. If these grouped words have synonyms in the Thesaurus then these synonyms will be appended to the search string.
For example, a search for "fred flute player" will result in a Thesaurus lookup of synonyms for "fred flute", "flute player" (matches "flautist") and "fred flute player". The search string in this case will be modified on-the-fly to read "fred flute player flautist"
If set to Yes, Search Page will not replace the keywords that might be used in the user input on the frontend.
